MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo Class Reference

Inherits from MaplyRemoteTileInfo : NSObject
Conforms to MaplyRemoteTileSourceDelegate
Declared in MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

Overview

You can use these to merge different sources together (assuming they can be merged), returning image and/or vector tiles.

– initWithViewC:

Initialze the multi source tile info object. Fill in everything else later.

- (id)initWithViewC:(MaplyBaseViewController *)viewC

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

  imageLayer

The object needs this if you’re parsing vector tiles.

@property (nonatomic, weak) MaplyQuadImageTilesLayer *imageLayer

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

  accessToken

If set, we’ll use an access key to get map data.

@property (nonatomic, strong) NSString *accessToken

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

– addImageMap:minZoom:maxZoom:type:

Add an image based map covering the given levels.

- (bool)addImageMap:(NSString *)map minZoom:(int)minZoom maxZoom:(int)maxZoom type:(NSString *)imageType

Discussion

This adds an image based map of the given type (e.g. jpg or png) at the given levels.

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

– addVectorMap:style:styleType:minZoom:maxZoom:

Add a vector map at the given levels.

- (bool)addVectorMap:(NSString *)map style:(NSData *)styleSheet styleType:(MapnikStyleType)styleType minZoom:(int)minZoom maxZoom:(int)maxZoom

Discussion

This adds a vector map for the given levels

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

– addTileSpec:

Add a vector or image map, depending on the tile spec.

- (bool)addTileSpec:(NSDictionary *)tileSpec

Discussion

This version parses a tile spec and figures out what we’re loading from there.

Declared In

MapboxMultiSourceTileInfo.h

– addTileSpec:minZoom:maxZoom:

Add a vector or image map, depending on the tile spec.

- (bool)addTileSpec:(NSDictionary *)tileSpec minZoom:(int)minZoom maxZoom:(int)maxZoom

Discussion

This version parses a tile spec and figures out what we’re loading from there.

You can also override which zoom levels to use.
